attributes.action: direct the Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport to intervene and provide positive solutions to end the pay dispute in English Heritage.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Members of the Public and Commercial Services Union working for English Heritage have been presented with a pay offer that will introduce:

Regional pay ranges and market and performance pay.      

The proposals form part of a three year deal and will have a devastating impact on staff in the lower bands and in Visitor Operations, as the proposals will affect future pension entitlement and annual pay increases.

While English Heritage management plan to reduce our members’ salaries, they are looking to reward other staff in the
organisation with large pay rises.

Our members provide vital support to specialist staff and are essential to attracting visitors, educating school children and promoting the organisation and its work on the hundreds of sites across the country.

Support our campaign for fair pay for a fair day’s work at English Heritage.

For more information contact Catherine Craig, PCS negotiations officer on 020 7801 2764.
